metadata.title: CVE-2023-39414 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.description: Multiple integer underflow vulnerabilities exist in the LXT2lxt2_rd_iter_radix shift operation functionality of GTKWave 3.3.115. Aspecially crafted .lxt2 file can lead to memory corruption. A victim wouldneed to open a malicious file to trigger these vulnerabilities.Thisvulnerability concerns the integer underflow when performing the rightshift operation.

criterions.comment: gtkwave: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
